title: Applications of Plane Analytic Geometry
description: Applications of plane analytic geometry in coordinate geometry problems, geometric proofs, and real-world modeling.

title: Distance and Midpoint Formulas
description: Using distance and midpoint formulas to calculate distances between points and find midpoints of line segments in a plane.

title: Equations of Lines in a Plane
description: Different forms of equations of lines (slope-intercept form, point-slope form, standard form) and converting between them.

title: Slope of a Line and Parallel and Perpendicular Lines
description: Understanding the concept of slope, and conditions for parallel and perpendicular lines in terms of their slopes.

title: The Cartesian Coordinate System in Plane Geometry
description: Introduction to the Cartesian coordinate system and its use in representing points and figures in a plane.

title: Applications of Set Operations
description: Applying set operations to solve real-world problems, including categorization, data analysis, and logical reasoning.

title: Basic Set Definitions and Notation
description: Understanding the fundamental definitions and notations used in set theory, including elements, sets, and common set notations.

title: Set Operations: Complement and Difference
description: Understanding set complement and difference operations, including absolute and relative complements, and applying these operations to solve problems.

title: Set Operations: Union and Intersection
description: Learning about the operations of union and intersection on sets, and how to perform these operations and interpret the results.

title: Types of Sets and Venn Diagrams
description: Exploring different types of sets such as subsets, universal sets, empty sets, and representing sets visually using Venn diagrams.

title: Applications of Ratio, Proportion, and Variation
description: Real-world applications of ratio, proportion, and variation in fields such as scaling, mixtures, and physics.

title: Direct Variation
description: Exploring direct variation relationships, identifying the constant of proportionality, and solving direct variation problems.

title: Inverse Variation
description: Understanding inverse variation relationships and solving problems involving inverse proportionality.

title: Joint and Combined Variation
description: Exploring joint variation (variation with multiple variables) and combined variation (combinations of direct and inverse variation).

title: Understanding Ratios and Proportions
description: Defining ratios and proportions, and solving problems involving proportional relationships.

title: Applications of Multiple Integrals
description: Applications of multiple integrals in finding volumes, mass, center of mass, and moments of inertia.

title: Double Integrals in Polar Coordinates
description: Evaluating double integrals using polar coordinates and converting between Cartesian and polar integrals.

title: Double Integrals over General Regions
description: Evaluating double integrals over general bounded regions and setting up limits of integration.

title: Introduction to Double Integrals
description: Introducing double integrals over rectangular regions and understanding their interpretation as volume.

title: Triple Integrals in Cartesian Coordinates
description: Extending integration to triple integrals in Cartesian coordinates and evaluating triple integrals.

title: Applications of Definite Integrals in Geometry
description: Geometric applications of definite integrals, including area, volume, arc length, and surface area calculations.

title: Arc Length and Surface Area of Revolution
description: Calculating arc length and surface area of revolution using definite integrals.

title: Area Between Curves Using Definite Integrals
description: Using definite integrals to calculate the area between curves in the plane.

title: Volume by Cylindrical Shells Method
description: Using the cylindrical shells method to find volumes of solids of revolution with definite integrals.

title: Volume by Slicing, Disk, and Washer Methods
description: Calculating volumes of solids using slicing, disk, and washer methods with definite integrals.

title: Applications of Sequences and Series
description: Applications of sequences and series in compound interest, annuities, and other financial and mathematical models.

title: Arithmetic Sequences and Series
description: Exploring arithmetic sequences, finding the nth term, and calculating the sum of arithmetic series.

title: Geometric Sequences and Series
description: Understanding geometric sequences, finding the nth term, and calculating the sum of finite and infinite geometric series.

title: Infinite Geometric Series and Convergence
description: Conditions for convergence of infinite geometric series and calculating the sum of convergent infinite geometric series.

title: Introduction to Sequences and Series
description: Defining sequences and series, understanding notation, and distinguishing between arithmetic and geometric sequences.

title: Applications of Divergence Test
description: Applications and limitations of the Divergence Test in determining series behavior.

title: Convergence and Divergence of Sequences
description: Determining convergence and divergence of sequences and finding limits of convergent sequences.

title: Convergence and Divergence of Series
description: Determining convergence and divergence of infinite series and understanding the concept of sum.

title: Introduction to Series and Sequences
description: Defining series and sequences and understanding basic terminology.

title: The Test for Divergence
description: Using the Test for Divergence to determine if a series diverges.

title: Applications of Surfaces in 3D Geometry
description: Applications of surfaces in 3D geometry, computer graphics, and modeling 3D objects.

title: Cylindrical and Spherical Coordinates
description: Introducing cylindrical and spherical coordinate systems and converting between Cartesian, cylindrical, and spherical coordinates.

title: Hyperboloids and Cones
description: Understanding hyperboloids and cones as types of quadric surfaces, their equations, and properties.

title: Parametric Surfaces
description: Representing surfaces parametrically and understanding parametric equations of surfaces.

title: Quadric Surfaces: Ellipsoids and Paraboloids
description: Exploring quadric surfaces, focusing on ellipsoids and paraboloids, their standard equations, and properties.

title: Applications of the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
description: Applications of the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus in evaluating integrals and solving problems in calculus.

title: Definition of the Definite Integral
description: Formal definition of the definite integral as a limit of Riemann sums and understanding its geometric interpretation as area.

title: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus Part 1
description: Understanding and applying the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus Part 1 to evaluate derivatives of integrals.

title: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus Part 2
description: Understanding and applying the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus Part 2 to evaluate definite integrals using antiderivatives.

title: Properties of Definite Integrals
description: Exploring properties of definite integrals, such as linearity, additivity, and comparison properties.

title: Combining Differentiation Rules
description: Combining power rule, product rule, quotient rule, and chain rule to differentiate complex functions.

title: The Chain Rule for Differentiation
description: Mastering the chain rule for differentiating composite functions and understanding its applications.

title: The Power Rule for Differentiation
description: Understanding and applying the power rule for differentiation to find derivatives of power functions.

title: The Product Rule for Differentiation
description: Using the product rule to find derivatives of products of two functions.

title: The Quotient Rule for Differentiation
description: Applying the quotient rule to find derivatives of quotients of two functions.

title: Applications of Equations in One Variable
description: Applying equations in one variable to solve word problems and real-life scenarios in various disciplines.

title: Solving Linear Equations in One Variable
description: Methods for solving linear equations with one variable, including using inverse operations and properties of equality.

title: Solving Quadratic Equations in One Variable
description: Techniques for solving quadratic equations, including factoring, using the quadratic formula, and completing the square.

title: Solving Radical Equations in One Variable
description: Methods for solving equations containing radical expressions, including isolating the radical and squaring both sides.

title: Solving Rational Equations in One Variable
description: Solving equations involving rational expressions, including identifying extraneous solutions and handling proportions.

title: Applications of Spherical Trigonometry
description: Applications of spherical trigonometry in astronomy, navigation on Earth, and other fields involving spherical geometry.

title: Introduction to Spherical Trigonometry
description: Introducing spherical trigonometry and its differences from plane trigonometry, focusing on triangles on a sphere.

title: Laws of Sines and Cosines in Spherical Trigonometry
description: Exploring the Law of Sines and Law of Cosines as they apply to spherical triangles.

title: Solving Spherical Triangles
description: Methods for solving spherical triangles, including finding angles and sides using spherical trigonometric laws.

title: Spherical Triangles and Great Circles
description: Understanding spherical triangles, great circles, and the properties of triangles on a sphere.

title: Solving Trigonometric Equations
description: Techniques for solving trigonometric equations, including using identities, factoring, and finding general solutions.

title: Trigonometric Identities: Double-Angle and Half-Angle Formulas
description: Applying double-angle and half-angle formulas to simplify trigonometric expressions and solve equations.

title: Trigonometric Identities: Pythagorean Identities
description: Understanding and applying Pythagorean identities to simplify trigonometric expressions and solve equations.

title: Trigonometric Identities: Sum and Difference Formulas
description: Using sum and difference formulas for sine, cosine, and tangent to evaluate trigonometric functions and simplify expressions.

title: Verifying Trigonometric Identities
description: Methods for verifying trigonometric identities by manipulating one side of the equation to match the other side.

title: Applications of Continuity
description: Applications of continuity in ensuring smooth transitions, modeling continuous processes, and in advanced calculus concepts.

title: Continuity on an Interval
description: Extending the concept of continuity to intervals and understanding continuity on open and closed intervals.

title: Definition of Continuity at a Point
description: Defining continuity at a point and understanding the conditions for continuity.

title: Properties of Continuous Functions
description: Exploring properties of continuous functions, such as the Intermediate Value Theorem and Extreme Value Theorem.

title: Types of Discontinuities
description: Identifying different types of discontinuities (removable, jump, infinite) and understanding their properties.

title: Applications of Differentials
description: Applications of differentials in approximating function values, error analysis, and in physics and engineering.

title: Differentials vs Derivatives
description: Distinguishing between differentials and derivatives and understanding their relationship.

title: Error Estimation Using Differentials
description: Estimating errors in measurements and calculations using differentials.

title: Introduction to Differentials
description: Introducing the concept of differentials and understanding the differential dx and dy.

title: Linear Approximation Using Differentials
description: Using differentials to approximate changes in function values and understanding linear approximation.

title: Applications of Power Series
description: Applications of power series in approximations, solving differential equations, and advanced mathematical analysis.

title: Convergence of Power Series
description: Determining convergence of power series and understanding the interval of convergence.

title: Differentiation and Integration of Power Series
description: Performing differentiation and integration of power series within their interval of convergence.

title: Introduction to Power Series
description: Defining power series and understanding their form and representation.

title: Representing Functions as Power Series
description: Representing functions as power series using Taylor series and Maclaurin series.

title: Applications of Partial Fraction Decomposition
description: Applications of partial fraction decomposition in calculus, particularly in integration and solving differential equations.

title: Decomposition with Improper Rational Functions
description: Performing partial fraction decomposition on improper rational functions by first using polynomial long division.

title: Partial Fraction Decomposition: Linear Factors
description: Decomposing rational expressions into partial fractions with distinct linear factors in the denominator.

title: Partial Fraction Decomposition: Quadratic Factors
description: Decomposing rational expressions with irreducible quadratic factors in the denominator.

title: Partial Fraction Decomposition: Repeated Linear Factors
description: Handling repeated linear factors in the denominator when performing partial fraction decomposition.

title: Applications of Inverse Trigonometric Functions
description: Applications of inverse trigonometric functions in solving right triangles, navigation, and other geometric problems.

title: Graphs of Inverse Trigonometric Functions
description: Graphing inverse sine, inverse cosine, and inverse tangent functions and understanding their key features.

title: Inverse Cosine Function and its Properties
description: Defining the inverse cosine function (arccos), understanding its domain and range, and evaluating inverse cosine values.

title: Inverse Sine Function and its Properties
description: Defining the inverse sine function (arcsin), understanding its domain and range, and evaluating inverse sine values.

title: Inverse Tangent Function and its Properties
description: Defining the inverse tangent function (arctan), understanding its domain and range, and evaluating inverse tangent values.

title: Applications of Linear Equations in Geometry
description: Using linear equations to solve geometric problems involving lines, distances, and intersections.

title: Parallel and Perpendicular Lines Equations
description: Finding equations of lines that are parallel or perpendicular to a given line and passing through a specific point.

title: Point-Slope Form of a Line
description: Using the point-slope form (y - y1 = m(x - x1)) to find equations of lines when given a point and the slope.

title: Slope-Intercept Form of a Line
description: Understanding the slope-intercept form (y = mx + b) and using it to graph lines and find equations of lines.

title: Standard Form of a Line
description: Understanding the standard form (Ax + By = C) and converting equations of lines to standard form.

title: Formulating Linear Equations from Real-World Data
description: Developing linear equations from real-world data sets, including data fitting and linear regression concepts.

title: Graphing Linear Equations to Solve Applications
description: Using graphical methods to solve applications of linear equations, including finding intersections and interpreting graphs in context.

title: Linear Equations in Business and Economics
description: Applications of linear equations in business and economics, such as cost-volume-profit analysis, supply and demand, and break-even analysis.

title: Linear Equations in Science and Engineering
description: Using linear equations to model and solve problems in science and engineering, including motion, force, and circuit analysis.

title: Word Problems Involving Linear Equations
description: Translating word problems into linear equations and solving them, including problems related to rate, mixture, and geometry.

title: Evaluating Algebraic Expressions
description: Understand how to evaluate algebraic expressions by substituting given values for variables and performing the arithmetic operations.

title: Factoring Algebraic Expressions
description: Techniques for factoring algebraic expressions, including factoring out common factors, factoring quadratic expressions, and special factoring patterns.

title: Operations with Algebraic Fractions
description: Performing operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division with algebraic fractions, including simplifying rational expressions.

title: Polynomial Expressions
description: Introduction to polynomial expressions, including identifying terms, coefficients, degrees, and types of polynomials.

title: Simplifying Algebraic Expressions
description: Learn how to simplify algebraic expressions by combining like terms, using the distributive property, and applying order of operations.

title: Average Value of a Function
description: Calculating the average value of a function over an interval using definite integrals.

title: Center of Mass and Centroids
description: Finding the center of mass and centroids of regions and solids using integrals.

title: Fluid Pressure and Force
description: Using integrals to calculate fluid pressure and force against submerged surfaces.

title: Probability and Integrals
description: Applications of integrals in probability, including probability density functions and cumulative distribution functions.

title: Work Done by a Variable Force
description: Using integrals to calculate work done by a variable force, such as in stretching a spring or lifting a chain.

title: Applications of Volume Under a Surface
description: Applications of volume under a surface calculations in geometry, physics, and engineering.

title: Setting Up Double Integrals for Volume Calculation
description: Strategies for setting up double integrals to calculate volumes of various regions under surfaces.

title: Using Polar Coordinates for Volume Calculation
description: Using double integrals in polar coordinates to calculate volumes under surfaces with circular symmetry.

title: Volume as a Double Integral
description: Calculating volume under a surface using double integrals and setting up the integral limits.

title: Volume Between Two Surfaces
description: Finding the volume between two surfaces using double integrals and setting up appropriate integral limits.

title: Applications of Limits in Multivariable Calculus
description: Applications of limits in defining continuity, partial derivatives, and understanding behavior of multivariable functions.

title: Continuity of Functions of Several Variables
description: Extending the concept of continuity to functions of several variables and understanding conditions for continuity.

title: Iterated Limits and Double Limits
description: Distinguishing between iterated limits and double limits and evaluating limits of functions of two variables.

title: Limits of Functions of Two Variables
description: Extending the concept of limits to functions of two variables and understanding the definition of limit.

title: Paths of Approach and Non-Existence of Limits
description: Using paths of approach to show non-existence of limits for functions of two variables.

title: Applications of Systems of Linear Equations
description: Applying systems of linear equations to solve multi-variable problems in fields like economics, engineering, and science.

title: Inconsistent and Dependent Systems
description: Identifying and understanding inconsistent systems (no solution) and dependent systems (infinite solutions) in linear equations.

title: Solving Systems of Linear Equations by Elimination
description: Employing the elimination method to solve systems of linear equations, focusing on adding or subtracting equations to eliminate variables.

title: Solving Systems of Linear Equations by Substitution
description: Using the substitution method to solve systems of two or three linear equations in two or three variables.

title: Systems of Linear Equations in Three Variables
description: Extending methods to solve systems of linear equations with three variables, including using matrices or combinations of substitution and elimination.

title: Choosing the Right Integration Technique
description: Strategies for choosing the appropriate integration technique (u-substitution, integration by parts, trigonometric substitution, partial fractions).

title: Integration by Parts
description: Learning and applying integration by parts for integrals involving products of functions.

title: Partial Fractions Integration
description: Using partial fraction decomposition to integrate rational functions.

title: Trigonometric Integrals
description: Techniques for integrating powers of trigonometric functions and products of trigonometric functions.

title: Trigonometric Substitution
description: Using trigonometric substitution to evaluate integrals involving square roots of quadratic expressions.

title: Composition of Functions
description: Understanding the composition of functions and performing operations of function composition.

title: Graphs of Functions and Transformations
description: Graphing functions, understanding transformations of graphs (shifts, stretches, reflections), and analyzing graphs of functions.

title: Introduction to Functions and Function Notation
description: Defining functions, understanding function notation, domain, and range, and identifying functions.

title: Inverse Functions
description: Finding inverse functions, determining if a function has an inverse, and understanding properties of inverse functions.

title: Types of Functions: Linear, Quadratic, Polynomial, Rational
description: Exploring different types of functions, including linear, quadratic, polynomial, and rational functions, and their properties.

title: Advantages of Logarithmic Differentiation
description: Understanding the advantages of using logarithmic differentiation for simplifying complex differentiation problems.

title: Applications of Logarithmic Differentiation
description: Applications of logarithmic differentiation in optimization problems and simplifying complex derivatives in various fields.

title: Introduction to Logarithmic Differentiation
description: Introducing logarithmic differentiation as a technique to differentiate complex functions involving products, quotients, and powers.

title: Logarithmic Differentiation with Variable Exponents
description: Using logarithmic differentiation to differentiate functions with variable bases and variable exponents.

title: Steps for Logarithmic Differentiation
description: Learning the steps for logarithmic differentiation, including taking logarithms, differentiating implicitly, and simplifying.

title: Arc Length and Surface Area of Revolution
description: Using definite integrals to calculate arc length of curves and surface area of solids of revolution.

title: Area Between Curves Using Definite Integrals
description: Using definite integrals to calculate the area between two curves in the plane.

title: Volume by Cylindrical Shells
description: Using the method of cylindrical shells to calculate volumes of solids of revolution.

title: Volume by Disk and Washer Methods
description: Using the disk and washer methods to calculate volumes of solids of revolution.

title: Volume by Slicing
description: Calculating volumes of solids by slicing and using definite integrals to sum up volumes of slices.

title: Absolute Value Expressions and Equations
description: Understanding absolute value expressions, solving equations involving absolute values, and graphing absolute value functions.

title: Applications of Rational, Radical, and Absolute Value Expressions
description: Real-world applications of rational, radical, and absolute value expressions in various fields like physics, engineering, and economics.

title: Radical Expressions: Simplification and Operations
description: Learn to simplify radical expressions, understand properties of radicals, and perform operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.

title: Rational Expressions: Simplification and Operations
description: Focus on simplifying rational expressions and performing operations like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.

title: Working with Complex Rational Expressions
description: Techniques for simplifying complex rational expressions, including expressions with nested fractions and negative exponents.

title: Applications of Functions of Several Variables
description: Applications of functions of several variables in optimization, physics, economics, and other multi-dimensional contexts.

title: Functions of Three or More Variables
description: Extending the concept of functions to three or more variables and understanding their properties.

title: Graphs and Level Curves of Functions of Two Variables
description: Graphing functions of two variables and understanding level curves (contour lines) and their interpretations.

title: Introduction to Functions of Several Variables
description: Defining functions of several variables, understanding domain and range, and function notation.

title: Partial Derivatives and Rates of Change
description: Introducing partial derivatives as rates of change with respect to one variable while holding others constant.

title: Applications of Polar Coordinates
description: Applications of polar coordinates in navigation, physics, and engineering problems involving radial symmetry.

title: Area in Polar Coordinates
description: Calculating areas of regions bounded by polar curves using integration in polar coordinates.

title: Graphs of Polar Equations
description: Graphing polar equations, including circles, lines, and more complex curves in polar coordinates.

title: Introduction to Polar Coordinates
description: Introducing the polar coordinate system, converting between polar and Cartesian coordinates, and plotting points in polar coordinates.

title: Polar Equations of Conic Sections
description: Representing conic sections using polar equations and understanding their properties in polar form.

title: Applications of Gradient and Directional Derivatives
description: Applications of gradient and directional derivatives in optimization, physics, and engineering.

title: Directional Derivatives: Definition and Calculation
description: Defining directional derivatives and calculating directional derivatives in any direction.

title: Gradient Vector and its Geometric Interpretation
description: Introducing the gradient vector and understanding its geometric interpretation as direction of steepest ascent.

title: Level Curves and Gradients
description: Understanding the relationship between level curves (contour lines) and gradient vectors.

title: Maximum Rate of Change and Direction of Steepest Ascent
description: Using the gradient vector to find the maximum rate of change and the direction of steepest ascent for a function.

title: Applications of Trigonometry in Navigation and Surveying
description: Real-world applications of trigonometry in navigation, surveying, and calculating distances and heights.

title: Area of Triangles Using Trigonometry
description: Calculating the area of triangles using trigonometric formulas, including Heron's formula and the formula involving sine.

title: Law of Cosines
description: Understanding and applying the Law of Cosines to solve oblique triangles, particularly when given side-angle-side or side-side-side.

title: Law of Sines
description: Understanding and applying the Law of Sines to solve oblique triangles (non-right triangles).

title: Solving Right Triangles Using Trigonometry
description: Using trigonometric ratios to solve right triangles, find missing sides and angles in practical problems.

title: Applications of Solids with Volume = 1/3 (Base Area * Height)
description: Real-world applications of pyramids and cones in architecture, design, and other fields.

title: Cones
description: Understanding cones, their properties, and volume calculations.

title: Pyramids
description: Exploring pyramids, their properties, types, and volume calculations.

title: Surface Area of Pyramids and Cones
description: Calculating the surface area of pyramids and cones, including lateral surface area and total surface area.

title: Volume of Pyramids and Cones
description: Calculating the volume of pyramids and cones using the formula Volume = 1/3 * (Base Area * Height).

title: Applications of Vectors in Physics and Geometry
description: Applications of vectors in physics (force, velocity) and geometry (lines, planes, distances).

title: Cross Product of Vectors in Three Dimensions
description: Introducing the cross product of vectors in three dimensions, its properties, and applications in finding areas and volumes.

title: Dot Product of Vectors
description: Understanding the dot product of vectors, its properties, and applications in finding angles and projections.

title: Vectors in Three Dimensions: Components and Operations
description: Extending vectors to three dimensions, vector components in 3D, and vector operations in three dimensions.

title: Vectors in Two Dimensions: Components and Operations
description: Introducing vectors in two dimensions, vector components, vector addition, subtraction, and scalar multiplication.

title: Applications of Inequalities
description: Applying inequalities to solve optimization problems, constraint problems, and real-world scenarios involving ranges and limits.

title: Solving Compound Inequalities
description: Solving compound inequalities involving 'and' and 'or' conditions and representing their solutions.

title: Solving Linear Inequalities in One Variable
description: Methods for solving linear inequalities in one variable and representing solutions on a number line and in interval notation.

title: Solving Quadratic Inequalities
description: Techniques for solving quadratic inequalities, including using test intervals and graphical methods.

title: Solving Rational Inequalities
description: Solving inequalities involving rational expressions, including identifying critical points and test intervals.

title: Applications of Conic Sections
description: Applications of conic sections in optics, astronomy, engineering, and architecture.

title: Ellipses and Hyperbolas
description: Exploring ellipses and hyperbolas, their standard equations, foci, vertices, and asymptotes.

title: Equations of Conic Sections in Standard Form
description: Writing equations of conic sections in standard form and identifying the type of conic section from its equation.

title: Graphing Conic Sections
description: Graphing circles, parabolas, ellipses, and hyperbolas from their equations and identifying key features.

title: Introduction to Conic Sections: Circles and Parabolas
description: Defining conic sections and focusing on circles and parabolas, their standard equations, and properties.

title: Applications of Sequences and Series in Calculus
description: Applications of sequences and series in representing functions, approximations, and advanced calculus topics.

title: Convergence and Divergence of Sequences
description: Determining convergence and divergence of sequences and finding limits of convergent sequences.

title: Convergence and Divergence of Series
description: Determining convergence and divergence of infinite series and understanding the concept of sum of a convergent series.

title: Geometric Series and Telescoping Series
description: Analyzing geometric series and telescoping series and calculating their sums when convergent.

title: Introduction to Sequences and Series
description: Defining sequences and series, understanding notation, and basic properties.

title: Applications of Trigonometric Functions
description: Applications of trigonometric functions in physics, engineering, navigation, and other fields.

title: Graphs of Trigonometric Functions
description: Graphing sine, cosine, tangent, cosecant, secant, and cotangent functions and understanding their properties (amplitude, period, phase shift).

title: Introduction to Trigonometric Functions
description: Defining the six trigonometric functions (sine, cosine, tangent, cosecant, secant, cotangent) using the unit circle and right triangles.

title: Inverse Trigonometric Functions
description: Understanding the concept of inverse trigonometric functions and evaluating inverse trigonometric functions.

title: Trigonometric Functions of Special Angles
description: Evaluating trigonometric functions for special angles (30, 45, 60, and their radian equivalents) and using the unit circle.

title: Applications of Complex Numbers
description: Exploring applications of complex numbers in fields such as electrical engineering, quantum mechanics, and signal analysis.

title: Graphical Representation of Complex Numbers
description: Representing complex numbers graphically on the complex plane, including the Argand diagram and polar form.

title: Introduction to Complex Numbers
description: Defining complex numbers, imaginary units, and the complex number system, including standard form and basic properties.

title: Operations with Complex Numbers
description: Performing arithmetic operations with complex numbers, including addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.

title: Polar Form of Complex Numbers and De Moivre's Theorem
description: Converting complex numbers to polar form and using De Moivre's Theorem for powers and roots of complex numbers.

title: Derivatives of Exponential and Logarithmic Functions
description: Finding derivatives of exponential functions (including e^x) and logarithmic functions (including ln(x)).

title: Derivatives of Inverse Trigonometric Functions
description: Learning derivative rules for inverse trigonometric functions such as arcsin(x), arccos(x), and arctan(x).

title: Derivatives of Polynomial Functions
description: Learning to find derivatives of polynomial functions using the power rule and sum/difference rule.

title: Derivatives of Rational Functions
description: Applying differentiation rules to find derivatives of rational functions.

title: Derivatives of Trigonometric Functions
description: Memorizing and applying derivative rules for sine, cosine, tangent, and other trigonometric functions.

title: Basic Integration Formulas: Power Rule and Sum Rule
description: Learning basic integration formulas, including the power rule for integration and the sum rule.

title: Integrals of Exponential and Logarithmic Functions
description: Finding integrals of exponential functions (including e^x) and logarithmic functions (including 1/x).

title: Integrals of Trigonometric Functions
description: Memorizing and applying integration formulas for trigonometric functions (sine, cosine, tangent, etc.).

title: Integration by Substitution (u-Substitution)
description: Learning and applying the technique of integration by substitution (u-substitution) for more complex integrals.

title: Using Integration Formulas and Substitution Together
description: Combining basic integration formulas and u-substitution to solve a wider range of integrals.

title: Applying L'Hospital's Rule for 0/0 Form
description: Using L'Hospital's Rule to evaluate limits of functions in the indeterminate form 0/0.

title: Applying L'Hospital's Rule for / Form
description: Using L'Hospital's Rule to evaluate limits of functions in the indeterminate form /.

title: Indeterminate Forms and L'Hospital's Rule
description: Identifying indeterminate forms (0/0, /) and introducing L'Hospital's Rule for evaluating limits of indeterminate forms.

title: Limitations and Exceptions to L'Hospital's Rule
description: Understanding limitations and conditions under which L'Hospital's Rule is applicable and recognizing cases where it should not be used.

title: Other Indeterminate Forms and Transformations to 0/0 or /
description: Handling other indeterminate forms (0*, -, 1^, 0^0, ^0) by transforming them into 0/0 or / to apply L'Hospital's Rule.

title: Applications of Solids with Volume = Base Area * Height
description: Real-world applications of prisms and cylinders in calculating volumes of containers, buildings, and other structures.

title: Cubes and Rectangular Solids
description: Focusing on cubes and rectangular solids as special types of prisms, and calculating their surface area and volume.

title: Prisms and Cylinders
description: Exploring prisms and cylinders, their properties, surface area, and volume calculations.

title: Surface Area of Prisms and Cylinders
description: Calculating the surface area of prisms and cylinders, including lateral surface area and total surface area.

title: Volume of Solids with Uniform Cross-Section
description: Understanding the principle that volume equals base area times height for solids with uniform cross-section.

title: Applications of Definite Integrals in Physics and Engineering
description: Applications of definite integrals in physics and engineering, such as work, energy, fluid dynamics, and mechanics.

title: Average Value of a Function
description: Calculating the average value of a function over an interval using definite integrals.

title: Center of Mass and Centroids
description: Finding center of mass and centroids of planar regions using definite integrals.

title: Fluid Pressure and Force
description: Calculating fluid pressure and force on submerged surfaces using definite integrals.

title: Work and Energy Using Integrals
description: Using integrals to calculate work done by variable forces and energy in physical systems.

title: Applications of Limits
description: Applications of limits in defining continuity, derivatives, and understanding the behavior of functions.

title: Intuitive Introduction to Limits
description: Providing an intuitive understanding of limits, limit notation, and graphical interpretation of limits.

title: Limit Laws and Techniques for Evaluating Limits
description: Learning and applying limit laws to evaluate limits algebraically and using techniques such as direct substitution and factoring.

title: Limits Involving Infinity
description: Exploring limits involving infinity, including infinite limits and limits at infinity, and horizontal asymptotes.

title: One-Sided Limits
description: Understanding and evaluating one-sided limits (left-hand and right-hand limits) and their relationship to two-sided limits.

title: Applications of Plane Figures in Geometry
description: Applications of plane figures in geometric proofs, constructions, and real-world problems involving shapes and areas.

title: Area and Perimeter of Plane Figures
description: Calculating the area and perimeter of various plane figures, including triangles, quadrilaterals, polygons, and circles.

title: Basic Plane Figures: Triangles and Quadrilaterals
description: Review of basic plane figures, focusing on triangles and quadrilaterals, their properties, and classifications.

title: Circles and their Properties
description: Understanding circles, their parts (radius, diameter, circumference, area), and related theorems.

title: Polygons and their Properties
description: Exploring polygons, their types, properties, interior and exterior angles, and classification.

title: Applications of Implicit Differentiation
description: Applications of implicit differentiation in related rates problems and finding slopes of tangent lines to implicitly defined curves.

title: Higher-Order Implicit Differentiation
description: Finding higher-order derivatives using implicit differentiation.

title: Implicit Differentiation with Trigonometric Functions
description: Applying implicit differentiation to find derivatives of implicitly defined trigonometric functions.

title: Introduction to Implicit Differentiation
description: Introducing implicit differentiation for finding derivatives of implicitly defined functions.

title: Steps for Implicit Differentiation
description: Learning the steps involved in performing implicit differentiation, including differentiating both sides and solving for dy/dx.

title: Concavity and Points of Inflection
description: Using the second derivative to determine concavity of a graph and find points of inflection.

title: Finding Critical Points and Intervals of Increase/Decrease
description: Using the first derivative to find critical points, intervals of increase and decrease, and to analyze function behavior.

title: Optimization Problems
description: Solving optimization problems using derivatives to find maximum and minimum values in applied contexts.

title: Using the First Derivative Test for Local Extrema
description: Applying the First Derivative Test to find local maxima and minima of functions.

title: Using the Second Derivative Test for Local Extrema
description: Applying the Second Derivative Test to find local maxima and minima of functions.

title: Applications of Improper Integrals
description: Applications of improper integrals in probability, physics, and other fields where integration over infinite intervals is needed.

title: Convergence and Divergence of Improper Integrals
description: Tests for convergence and divergence of improper integrals, including comparison tests and limit comparison tests.

title: Improper Integrals with Discontinuous Integrands
description: Evaluating improper integrals with discontinuous integrands and determining convergence or divergence.

title: Improper Integrals with Infinite Limits
description: Evaluating improper integrals with infinite limits of integration and determining convergence or divergence.

title: Introduction to Improper Integrals
description: Defining improper integrals with infinite limits of integration or discontinuous integrands.

title: Applications of Spheres in Geometry and Real World
description: Applications of spheres in geometry, geography, astronomy, and other real-world contexts.

title: Definition and Properties of a Sphere
description: Defining a sphere, understanding its properties, radius, diameter, and surface area and volume formulas.

title: Hemispheres and Spherical Segments
description: Exploring hemispheres and spherical segments, and calculating their surface area and volume.

title: Surface Area of a Sphere
description: Calculating the surface area of a sphere using the formula and applying it to solve problems.

title: Volume of a Sphere
description: Calculating the volume of a sphere using the formula and applying it to solve problems.

title: Applications of Combinatorial Mathematics
description: Applications of combinatorial mathematics in probability, statistics, computer science, and other fields.

title: Basic Counting Principles
description: Fundamental principles of counting, including the addition principle and the multiplication principle.

title: Combinations
description: Understanding combinations, calculating combinations of n objects taken r at a time, and solving combination problems.

title: Permutations
description: Understanding permutations, calculating permutations of n objects taken r at a time, and solving permutation problems.

title: Permutations vs Combinations
description: Distinguishing between permutations and combinations and choosing the appropriate method for counting problems.

title: Applications of Matrices
description: Applications of matrices in computer graphics, cryptography, and solving systems of equations.

title: Introduction to Matrices and Matrix Notation
description: Defining matrices, understanding matrix notation, and identifying different types of matrices (e.g., square, row, column).

title: Matrix Operations: Addition and Subtraction
description: Performing matrix addition and subtraction, understanding conditions for these operations, and properties of matrix addition.

title: Matrix Operations: Matrix Multiplication
description: Performing matrix multiplication, understanding conditions for multiplication, and properties of matrix multiplication.

title: Matrix Operations: Scalar Multiplication
description: Understanding scalar multiplication of matrices and its properties.

title: Applications of Radius and Interval of Convergence
description: Applications of radius and interval of convergence in determining the domain of power series representations and in numerical analysis.

title: Endpoint Behavior of Interval of Convergence
description: Analyzing the behavior of power series at the endpoints of their interval of convergence.

title: Interval of Convergence of a Power Series
description: Finding the interval of convergence of a power series, including checking endpoints.

title: Power Series Representation of Functions
description: Using power series to represent functions and finding the interval of convergence for these representations.

title: Radius of Convergence of a Power Series
description: Determining the radius of convergence of a power series using the Ratio Test or Root Test.

title: Applications of Partial Differentiation
description: Applications of partial differentiation in optimization, tangent planes, rates of change, and multivariable calculus.

title: Chain Rule for Partial Derivatives
description: Extending the chain rule to functions of several variables and applying it to find partial derivatives of composite functions.

title: Clairaut's Theorem on Mixed Partial Derivatives
description: Understanding and applying Clairaut's Theorem on the equality of mixed partial derivatives.

title: Higher-Order Partial Derivatives
description: Calculating higher-order partial derivatives and understanding mixed partial derivatives.

title: Partial Differentiation: First-Order Partial Derivatives
description: Introducing partial differentiation and calculating first-order partial derivatives with respect to each variable.

title: Comparison Test for Convergence
description: Using the Comparison Test to determine convergence or divergence by comparing series.

title: Limit Comparison Test for Convergence
description: Using the Limit Comparison Test to determine convergence or divergence by comparing limits of ratios of terms.

title: Ratio Test for Convergence
description: Using the Ratio Test to determine convergence or divergence based on the limit of ratios of consecutive terms.

title: Root Test for Convergence
description: Using the Root Test to determine convergence or divergence based on the limit of nth roots of terms.

title: The Integral Test for Convergence
description: Using the Integral Test to determine convergence or divergence of infinite series.

title: Applications of the Derivative Definition
description: Applications of the derivative definition in finding slopes of curves, rates of change, and in theoretical calculus.

title: Definition of the Derivative Using Limits
description: Formal definition of the derivative using limits and calculating derivatives using the limit definition.

title: Derivative as Rate of Change
description: Interpreting the derivative as the instantaneous rate of change and applying it to problems involving rates of change.

title: Introduction to the Derivative as Slope of Tangent Line
description: Introducing the derivative as the slope of the tangent line to a curve at a point and its geometric interpretation.

title: Notations for the Derivative
description: Understanding different notations for the derivative (Leibniz notation, Lagrange's notation, etc.) and their uses.

title: Applications of Differentiability and Continuity
description: Applications of differentiability and continuity in optimization, curve sketching, and advanced calculus theory.

title: Continuity Does Not Imply Differentiability
description: Understanding that continuity does not guarantee differentiability and exploring counterexamples.

title: Differentiability Implies Continuity
description: Understanding the theorem that differentiability at a point implies continuity at that point.

title: Points of Non-Differentiability
description: Identifying points where a function is not differentiable, such as corners, cusps, and vertical tangents.

title: Relationship between Graphs of f and f'
description: Analyzing the relationship between the graph of a function and the graph of its derivative.

title: Applications of Determinants
description: Applications of determinants in finding areas of triangles, volumes of parallelepipeds, and solving systems of linear equations using Cramer's Rule.

title: Determinant of a 2x2 Matrix
description: Calculating the determinant of a 2x2 matrix and understanding its geometric interpretation.

title: Determinant of a 3x3 Matrix
description: Calculating the determinant of a 3x3 matrix using cofactor expansion or row reduction.

title: Properties of Determinants
description: Exploring properties of determinants, such as how row operations and matrix transformations affect the determinant.

title: Using Determinants to Find Matrix Inverses
description: Using determinants to determine if a matrix is invertible and to calculate the inverse of a matrix.

title: Applications of Infinite Series
description: Applications of infinite series in representing functions, approximations, and advanced mathematical concepts.

title: Geometric Series and Convergence
description: Analyzing geometric series, determining conditions for convergence, and finding sums of convergent geometric series.

title: Harmonic Series and p-Series
description: Understanding harmonic series and p-series and determining their convergence or divergence.

title: Introduction to Infinite Series and Convergence
description: Defining infinite series and understanding the concept of convergence and divergence.

title: Telescoping Series and Partial Sums
description: Analyzing telescoping series and calculating their sums using partial sums.
